content: As a result, second quarter revenue declined by 10% to $9.1 million. Last year, we received subsidies from the Canadian Emergency Wages Subsidy Program to approximately $0.6 million in the second quarter, which expired in the third quarter of 2021. Our reported revenues for the second quarter of 2022 was $9.1 million, a decrease of 9.7% compared with the reported revenues of $10.1 million in the second quarter of 2021. The geography breakdown as a percentage of revenues for the second quarter of 2022 compared to the year ago quarter is as follows: North America, 41% versus 46%; Europe, 28% versus 22%; APAC, 29% in both periods; and Latin America, 2% versus 3%. Our reported operating expenses were $5.4 million, an increase of 11.2% from the prior year second quarter operating expenses of $4.8 million.
